Function

Abstruct classes for any function.

class mimic.core.Function.function_meta

Bases: object

Abstruct class for any function.

Note

Any function should be defined by classes inheriting function_meta, because forward method isn’t implemented. Codes in ./mimic/benchmark/ will help you.

forward(x: ndarray) → float | ndarray

Output function value

Parameters:

x (np.ndarray) – Solution which shape equals to (N, dim) or (N, ).

Returns:

Function value. If x.shape equals to (N, dim), return np.ndarray which shape equals to (N, ).

Return type:

(float, np.ndarray)

class mimic.core.Function.penalty_function(pfunc, weight: float = 1.0)

Bases: function_meta

Inequality penalty function

Parameters:

  • pfunc (function) – Penalty function of which input and output type should be same with forward method.

  • weight (float) – Weight parameter. Defaults to 1.0.

pfunc

Penalty function of which input and output type should be same with forward method.

Type:

function

weight

Weight parameter. Defaults to 1.0.

Type:

float

Note

MIMIC can adapt only pfunc(x) <= 0 like constraint

forward(x: ndarray) → float | ndarray

Output penalty function value

Parameters:

x (np.ndarray) – Solution which shape equals to (N, dim) or (N, ).

Returns:

Function value. If x.shape equals to (N, dim), return np.ndarray which shape equals to (N, ).

Return type:

(float, np.ndarray)
